rComments: Overall a solid teacher.  Got the information across well, slides were really informativedirect.  Homework was a bit tricky, reasonable.  He's a nice guy.  I'd take his class again.

I found the class boring. James is a good teacher and you can tell that he loves what he is doing. The lecture slides are really long and exams are hard but he curves a lot. I would recommend going to MSI if you are struggling they are really helpful. The slides get posted online so thats helpful.
Great professor! His lectures are extremely helpful! Exams are not easy, but make sure you study the lecture notes and practice the homework problems over and over again.

Fantastic teacher. Very inspiring, very clear in his explanations, very relatable, and very easy to understand. I thoroughly enjoyed his class (ENVS 25) because he taught PRACTICAL ways to deal with the environmental crisis instead of just preaching the hopelessness of the problems we are facing. He's super nice too and pretty funny. Great class.

Very knowledgable professor who is passionate about the environment. The midterm and final are not easy of course but they are curved. I honestly found the class slightly challenging. If you're passionate about the environment and politics then you'll enjoy the class.
Great teacher with extremely interesting lectures. He knows evereything about his subject and creates a creative environment in class. Take this course if the subject interests you!

ENVS 141 with James was great. Real smart guy, good at connecting environmental problems with economics, good at explaining various tools and concepts that apply to lots of problems. Not sure why people don't like him. Also I HIGHLY recommend IDEASS. Some people cant handle the pressure of having to apply yourself, but the class was very rewarding.

Don't waste your time with this guy... His ENVS 25 course is easy enough but he is a pro at assigning useless homework that is time-consuming yet never correlates with the material. I've never felt more unproductive than when I'm taking one of his classes. Also HUGE recommendation: Stay away from IDEASS!!! Completely unorganized and useless.
Really gets you thinking about what's going on in the world and positive steps we can take to change.

I am very surprised with the other comments of James. I personally thought he was a very down to earth cool guy who really knew his stuff. The class was very interesting and super easy as long as you came to class everyday. He seems to really care about the subject and teaches it with an open mind. One of my favorite classes so far.

James knows what he's talking about, and he's quite good at relaying his knowledge to his students. Though his powerpoints may not be always be exceptionally engaging, he's very easy to listen to, and he really seems to care about what his students are thinking. Lots of enthusiasm for the subject. Cool guy, solid class.

ENVS 25-- Great professor; his class was very organized, with clear and helpful powerpoints. He tried to make everything interesting and always presented real and current examples. He curved the tests and the online quizzes were easy. I don't understand why he has such a bad rating. I highly recommend this class

James is a great lecturer and he tries his best to keep class interesting and engaging. He's a cool guy who is very down to earth, personable, and funny. Classes are always powerpoint lectures or guest speakers, but he does a good job being animated and not dry. He is very fair and curved the midterm a lot which was awesome. And gives extra credit.

First off, he looks exactly like McLovin'. He seemed like a good teacher and the material was interesting but I really don't understand how these teachers can simply use an 1hr 45 min of class to just talk at us and show a boring powerpoint. Plus his T.A. Peter is the most unapproachable **** who makes you feel like an idiot.
Interesting material but very dry. Readings are very dry and so are lectures. Test was waaaay to detailed.

Pretty good class, I feel like you have to really not try to get a bad grade. What he teaches is interesting and very understandable. Very light work load. Quizzes were easy, same with midterm and final. Just pay attention and look over slides.
not fun ,got a d.

James is pretty arrogant sometimes. I walked into his office hours once and asked for help, but it seemed that he didn't want to help me at all. Online quizzes are tricky. Midterms and finals are quite fair and he curved them. This class has tons of workload.Overall, he knows his stuff quite well and the class it's interesting.

He totally killed this class for me. I do not recommend anyone to take this course with him. He goes to fast on the slides and get annoyed when students point it out. Overall he is boring and quizzes us on unnecessary readings

I feel like James knows what he is talking about and really enjoys the subject. I don't understand the unhappiness in the length of lecture slides when the class is 1hr and 45min long. Slides are also posted online which helps. The best way to study for the exams is note cards since it is basically all memorizing info. Reading is BIG on tests too.

the tests and quizzes are easy enough, but some of the things he states as fact are clearly disputable. he also makes sweeping generalizations about republicans and the US government in general that i find inappropriate and offensive.

He conducts lectures in the most inarticulate, arrogant, immature, unimaginative ways. It doesn't help that he stutters & mumbles. For example, he brings the same Crystal Geiser plastic bottle to class every day and uses it in all of his examples about environmental problems. I would not take a class with this guy again. It's not worth it.

wow this class was ridiculous. His powerpoints were so long and he got mad at us if we asked him to slow down. Review sheets basically said: memorize everything I ever said.also he seemed super arrogant sometimes. Best day of the class was when he didnt teach and a guest speaker taught us how to use a blowdart.

I was so excited to take this class in the beginning of spring quarter. After 3 classes I realized that it was basically a joke. Powerpoints too long, never stops talking, went to his office hours and wasn't helpful. If you really like rain forests take this class. If you're an environmental major don't waste your time. Trust me. Not worth it.

Lectures can get boring and slow - but content is super interesting and understandable to people who aren't good at science. Everything taught in class is relevant to our lives. Didn't do a lot/most of the readings, missed 4 or 5 lectures, studied a full day for the midterm and final and scored high on both. Good for people who love the rainforest
Oud playing dude....!

I thought this class was boring but i expected the james to grade fair. The dry nature of the subject was bad but having a professor who is both arrogant and difficult to work made it worse. I will never take a class with this guy again. Don't take this class unless you really like people with no charisma and no flexibility.

Saying you are a "Mac-a-phob" on the first day of class was such a low class comment I thought, that put aside, his sincerity never seemed as genuine as Alex's, in fact there was a subtle arrogance I'm sure most people noticed. The lectures were bleak, including the the guest lectures, except for Chris Bacon who was excellent.

One of the worst lecturers I have ever had. Powerpoints are way to long and impossible to take notes on, reading is extremely long and online and boring. No study guide. Writing assignments weren't that bad, but midterm and final were way to long. I was really looking forward to the class and he made me hate it.

James was the boring one. Alex was way cooler, and hotter. Something about james voice really bothered me, and his 'matter of fact' tone, when some of the stuff he said wasn't even legit. But, the class material was hella cool regardless. too much reading! bad midterm/final preparation, they don't even let you know what to study for.

horrible lecturer.  absolutely dry and doesn't know how to teach.  doesn't give a study guide for mid term, and doesn't use a text book at all, only online readings which makes it very difficult. don't take his class, even for GEs, it's not worth the boredom.  his lectures are the most boring lectures i have ever been to.
